clinical_study.brief_title: Pretreatment With Electroacupuncture to Reduce Discomfort
clinical_study.official_title: Pretreatment With Electroacupuncture to Reduce Discomfort

brief_summary.textblock: The main hypothesis is that performance of electroacupuncture before colonoscopy reduces pain during the exam.

detailed_description.textblock: To assess the efficacy of pre-colonoscopic electroacupuncture in reducing discomfort during colonoscopy.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of pre-colonoscopic electroacupuncture in reducing discomfort during colonoscopy by measuring sedative drug amounts during colonoscopy
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the colonoscopy and in the hour post procedure
primary_outcome.description: The measurement of the amount of drug added during colonoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of insertion till the cecum.
secondary_outcome.description: Time between insertion of the colonoscopy and the image of the cecum

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of post-colonoscopy recovery as measured by the Aldrete score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the begining of the endoscopy and up to 1 hour post procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's total satisfaction with the exam and the analgesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between the end of the procedure and up to 1 hour post procedure

arm_group.description: patients in whom precolonoscopic electroacupuncture is preformed

intervention.description: Patients allocated to this arm will receive electro-acupuncture bilaterally on the following points which are considered relevant both for sedation and abdominal distention:LI4 (Hegu),ii. St36 (Zusanli), Sp6 (Sanyinjiao), St25 (Tianshuv),. Du20 (Baihui),

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult Patients referred for their first colonoscopy in the department of GI in Sheba, Tel Hashomer
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Ages <18y >75y
2. Any prior gastrointestinal endoscopy.
3. History of colonic resection.
4. Known or suspected stenosis of the colon.
5. Pregnancy.
6. Inflammatory bowel disease
7. Neuropsychiatric disorders or receiving psychotropic drugs.
8. Prior knowledge or experience of acupuncture.
